content: sock yarn beanie by sue beard this beanie pattern is part of my ongoing quest to use up stashed sock yarn it can be made in any fingering/4ply sock yarn leftover scraps are ideal for striping or colour blocking it can be made in any size from newborn to adult and is knit in the round from the crown down to the brim there are two options for the crown knotted i-cord or a plain flat circle and two options for the brim either rolled or ribbed techniques used techniques used in this hat include knitting in the round i-cord optional photo tutorial https //blog tincanknits com/2019/01/26/how-to-knit-an-i-cord/ emily ocker s circular cast on video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=glt0c4o8fzs or invisible circular cast on video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=sedrjvb4wvm icelandic cast off video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=xxe53qqvbwq or russian cast off video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=fxd-ojak9-8 materials any standard fingering/4ply sock yarn 25 40 50 50 g fingering/4-ply yarn 400 m per 100 g 75% wool 25% nylon the samples were knit in various yarns i used 1 x 50 g ball for the adult size left over from knitting socks but you could use alternating stripes of scraps of yarn or a set of mini-skeins as in the purple sample self- striping and self-patterning yarns work particularly well the multicolour striped sample shown was knit in regia 4-fädig a lovely self patterning yarn that is sadly now discontinued the purple striped sample was knit in a little bit sheepish graduated hand-dyed mini-skein set the dark rainbow striped sample was knit in west yorkshire spinners signature 4ply in zara s rainbow tools use either a long circular needle for magic loop or a set of dpns in the following sizes 2 00 mm uk/canada size 14 us size 0 2 25 mm uk/canada size 13 us size 1 8 stitch markers one of which should be distinctive for start-of-round tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge 34 stitches x 48 row = 10 cm 4 on 2 25 cm needles in stocking stitch/stockinette in the round if your gauge does not match this go up or down a needle size and re-swatch gauge is important to get the correct fit but the construction method means you can try the hat on whilst it is still on the needles to ensure the fit is perfect © copyright 2023 sue beard page 1 of 3 version 1 2 19 december 2023 sock yarn
